item.title: 在米莱和卢拉之间，巴拉圭财政部长选择了紧缩之路
item.description: 拉丁美洲正在成为政府极端支出的战场，小国呼吁在后果蔓延到其他国家之前勒紧裤腰带。【原文：Latin America is becoming a battleground of government spending extremes, drawing calls from smaller nations to tighten the belt before the consequences spill across borders.】

item.title: 德国 12 月通胀率从 2.9% 更正为 2.8%
item.description: 德国统计局的数据显示，德国上个月的通货膨胀率从 11 月份的 2.4% 上升至 2.8%。【原文：German inflation accelerated to 2.8% last month, up from 2.4% in November, according to the country’s statistics office.】

item.title: 欧洲不应浪费摆脱俄罗斯天然气的机会
item.description:
终止经由乌克兰的能源流动为该地区提供了加强能源安全的新机遇。【原文：

The end of flows via Ukraine offers the region a fresh opportunity to bolster its energy security.

】

item.title: 盖蒂图片公司将收购 Shutterstock，创建价值 37 亿美元的公司
item.description: 盖蒂图片控股公司（Getty Images Holdings Inc.【原文：Getty Images Holdings Inc. agreed to acquire rival stock-photo provider Shutterstock Inc. in a deal that would create a combined company worth about $3.7 billion including debt.】

item.title: 机器人填补韩国老龄化社会的劳动力缺口
item.description: 人工智能开发人员说，机器人的未来指日可待。但首先...【原文：An office building called 1784 on the outskirts of Seoul offers a glimpse into the robotic future that artificial intelligence developers say is just around the corner. But first...】

item.title: 如何理解新时代特朗普世界的关税政策辩论
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫还有将近两周的时间，但他的关税计划已经在金融市场引起了轩然大波。对于任何关注此事的人来说，即将发生的事情都是值得借鉴的。【原文：Donald Trump is almost two weeks away from returning to the White House and yet his tariff plans are already causing whiplash in financial markets. And for anyone paying attention, there’s a lesson to be had there in what’s coming.】

item.title: 当 TikTok 的趋势机器关闭时会发生什么？
item.description:
面对迫在眉睫的禁令，品牌和创作者必须考虑在互联网失去其最重要的文化生产引擎的情况。【原文：

Facing a looming ban, brands and creators must contemplate the internet without its most important cultural production engine.

】

item.title: 巴尔带来惊喜，美联储与特朗普之间的潜在冲突即将上演
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂，波士顿的经济编辑。今天我们将探讨美联储意外宣布人事变动可能带来的影响。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net，或通过 @economics 在 X 上与我们联系。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at possible implications of a surprise personnel announcement at the Federal Reserve. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net or get in touch on X via @economics. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 恩智浦同意以 6.25 亿美元收购汽车软件制造商
item.description: 芯片制造商恩智浦半导体公司（NXP Semiconductors NV）同意以 6.25 亿美元现金收购奥地利汽车软件开发商 TTTech Auto，为软件定义汽车制造商开发产品。【原文：Chipmaker NXP Semiconductors NV agreed to buy Austrian automotive software developer TTTech Auto for $625 million in cash to build out its products for software-defined vehicle makers.】

item.title: 受美国关税言论和利率押注影响，兹罗提逼近五年高点
item.description: 波兰兹罗提兑欧元汇率接近2020年初以来的最强水平，原因是市场押注波兰国内将采取进一步的限制性货币政策，同时希望美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的第二任期对新兴市场资产的破坏性较小。【原文：Poland’s zloty traded near the strongest level against the euro since early 2020 on bets for further restrictive monetary policy at home and hopes for a less disruptive second term from US President-elect Donald Trump for emerging-market assets.】

item.title: 俄罗斯称 12 月原油产量减至欧佩克+目标以下
item.description: 据熟悉俄罗斯能源部数据的人士称，俄罗斯自己的数据显示，其 12 月份的原油产量低于欧佩克+的目标。【原文：Russia’s own data show its crude production in December fell below its OPEC+ target, according to people familiar with figures from the country’s Energy Ministry.】

item.title: 股票估值被拉伸到极致
item.description: 固定收益市场正在向股市多头发出警告：股票相对于公司信贷和国债的估值接近 20 年来最高。这是根据公司相对于其股价能创造多少利润（又称收益率）来衡量的。然后将其与投资者从债券中获得的收益率进行比较。传统观点认为，股票的 "盈利收益率 "应该更高，因为它们的风险更大。但股票【原文：Fixed-income markets are sending a warning to equity bulls: Stocks are close to the most overvalued against corporate credit and Treasuries in about two decades.That’s according to a metric that looks at how much profit companies can generate relative to their stock price, aka the earnings yield. And then compares that against how much yield an investor would earn from bonds. The classic view is that stocks should have a higher “earnings yield” because they are so much riskier. But with equities】

item.title: 美国将中国科技巨头列入黑名单有可能导致更快脱钩
item.description: 美国扩大中国军工企业名单的最新举动所带来的风险不仅仅是使中国一些最有价值的公司股价下跌：它还可能加速世界最大经济体的脱钩。【原文：The US’s latest move to expand its list of Chinese military companies risks doing more than tanking the shares of some of its most valuable companies: It also threatens to accelerate decoupling of the world’s biggest economies.】

item.title: 信贷市场发出信号，警告股市无情反弹
item.description: 美国债券市场发出的信号是，股票多头现在可能有点过于亢奋了。【原文：US bond markets are signaling that equity bulls may be a little too exuberant now.】

item.title: 英国将根据扩大后的科技权力开展两项数字市场调查
item.description: 英国反垄断监管机构本月将利用其扩大的权力对一些最大的科技公司展开两项调查，以遏制其在数字市场中的支配地位。【原文：The UK’s antitrust watchdog will start two investigations this month into some of the largest tech companies using its expanded powers to curb dominance in digital markets, the regulator said without naming the firms that could come under the net.】

item.title: 欧洲债券市场单日发行量超历史水平
item.description: 本周二，在欧洲出售债券的借款人数量创下历史新高，他们从假期归来，以利用接近三年来最窄的利差。【原文：A record number of borrowers are selling bonds in Europe on Tuesday, returning from the holidays to take advantage of spreads that are near the tightest in three years.】

item.title: 中国经济疲软、关税风险等因素影响，苹果一月处境艰难
item.description: 由于投资者担心关键的中国市场疲软，苹果公司（Apple Inc.【原文：Apple Inc. shares have had a challenging start to 2025, as investors fret over weakness in the critical Chinese market.】

item.title: 印度经济将出现大流行病以来最弱增长
item.description: 在消费者削减开支和公共投资放缓之后，印度政府将本财政年度的经济增长预期下调至大流行病以来最弱的水平。【原文：India’s government lowered its economic growth projection for the fiscal year to the weakest since the pandemic after consumers cut back on spending and public investment slowed.】

item.title: 南苏丹呼吁尽快重启达尔石油生产
item.description: 南苏丹政府要求达尔石油运营公司（Dar Petroleum Operating Co.【原文：South Sudan’s government called for the Dar Petroleum Operating Co. to begin resuming oil output on Wednesday, days after neighboring Sudan — through which crude flows to the coast — reopened the route for exports.】

item.title: 欧元区通胀反弹但不会阻碍欧洲央行降息
item.description: 上个月，欧元区通胀加速，支持了欧洲中央银行的渐进式降息策略，但并未使其完全脱轨。【原文：Euro-area inflation accelerated last month, supporting the European Central Bank’s gradual approach to reducing interest rates, without derailing them altogether.】

item.title: 印尼加入金砖国家，助推全球南方在世界舞台上的发展
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普的贸易政策给世界经济带来风险之际，印尼成为金砖国家集团的最新成员，此举将进一步支持全球南方国家。【原文：Indonesia has become the newest member of the BRICS group of developing nations, in a move that could further bolster the Global South as Donald Trump’s trade policies pose risks to world economy.】

item.title: 匈牙利开始 2025 年欧洲债券发行活动，未受疲软福林影响
item.description: 匈牙利坚持在年初获得国际融资的做法，并没有因为福林跌至两年来的低点而气馁。【原文：Hungary is sticking with its practice of securing international financing early in the year, undeterred by the forint’s slide toward two-year lows.】

item.title: 英国住宅建设连续第三个月下降，斯塔默遭遇挫折
item.description: 由于高利率和脆弱的消费者信心有可能阻碍工党政府促进建筑业发展的承诺，英国房屋建设以六个月来最快的速度下降。【原文：UK housebuilding dropped at the fastest pace in six months, as high interest rates and fragile consumer confidence threatened to hamper the Labour government’s pledge to boost construction.】

item.title: 交易员看淡欧元反弹，最快本月实现平价交易
item.description: 在美国准备迎接上一任总统复出之际，货币市场也在准备迎接一个罕见的事件：美元与欧元平价。【原文：As America gets ready for the return to office of a prior president, the currency market is preparing for a rare event of its own: Parity between the dollar and the euro.】

item.title: 英国 30 年期债券收益率攀升至 1998 年以来最高点
item.description: 由于交易商为出售债务腾出了空间，英国的长期借款成本升至 1998 年以来的最高水平。【原文：The UK’s long-term borrowing costs rose to the highest level since 1998 as traders made room for a sale of debt.】

item.title: 莱坊称 2024 年印度房屋销售量将创 12 年新高
item.description: 房地产咨询公司莱坊（Knight Frank）的一项研究显示，去年印度八个主要城市的住房销售总量超过 35 万套，是 12 年来最高的一年。【原文：Housing sales in eight major cities of India totaled over 350,000 units last year, the highest in 12 years, according to a research by real estate consultancy Knight Frank.】

item.title: 尼日利亚顶级银行零售股权发售融资 1.36 亿美元
item.description: 尼日利亚担保信托控股公司（Guaranty Trust Holding Co.【原文：Nigeria’s Guaranty Trust Holding Co. raised 209 billion naira ($136 million) selling shares locally, completing the first phase of a recapitalization plan to meet new industry rules.】

item.title: 欧洲最大股票牛市称 2025 年该地区可击败美国
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）的策略师表示，欧洲股市在去年严重落后于美国股市之后，在经济前景不断改善、企业盈利门槛较低的情况下，2025 年的前景将更加光明。【原文：European equities face a much brighter outlook in 2025 amid improving economic prospects and a low bar for corporate earnings after badly lagging US stocks last year, according to strategists at Deutsche Bank AG.】

item.title: 欧洲央行称 11 月消费者通胀预期上升
item.description: 欧洲中央银行称，11 月份欧元区消费者的通胀预期有所上升。【原文：Inflation expectations of consumers in the euro area increased in November, the European Central Bank said.】

item.title: 英国杂货通胀上升，因为购物者在圣诞节大肆挥霍
item.description: 由于圣诞节期间的家庭支出创下历史新高，英国 12 月份的杂货价格通胀率有所上升。【原文：UK grocery price inflation rose in December as household spending over Christmas hit a record.】
